Fields.DialogueText: Since we're going to be comrades in arms, I think we should set some ground rules, Kapitan.
Such as?
First, just because I am a woman does not mean I cannot fight. I do not need your help in battle.
Second, do not cross me. You do not want to make an enemy of me.

Fields.MenuText: I think we'll get along fine, Kavkaz.
Any other rules I should be aware of?
You're a bit pushy, aren't you, Kavkaz?

Fields.DialogueText: As long as you respect my rules, we will.
There is one more.
I am far more than that.
The final rule?
Do not ever call me "doll," "sweetie," "cutie", or any of the like. I am to be respected and taken seriously.
What happens if someone - accidentally, of course - does?
Please refer to the second rule.
*ALARM*
To battle, Kapitan.
This ought to be fun.
@BATTLE
Everyone, listen up. Command has issued our first mission.
There's a Protection Force base in our region. We've been assigned to protect it.
Understood.
Everyone, back to your stations. Kavkaz?
Da, Kapitan?
I've been meaning to ask you...

Fields.MenuText: Why do you wear such tall heels?
Why are you fighting?
Are you religious?

Fields.DialogueText: Who says my heels are tall? And why is that any of your business?
For the glory of the Soviet nation. Why else?
Da. I am Zoroastrian.
Hmm...
You should be careful, Kapitan.
I... should?
You do not want to get to know me.
Why wouldn't I?
*ALARM*
Camaraderie is a luxury, unnecessary for survival...
I'll prove it to you.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Time to show your fighting spirit, Kapitan.
Yes, well... I was honestly more frightened of breakfast.
@BATTLE
See? The enemy is soft.
We're received a distress signal from the base. Set a course for their location.
Da, Kapitan.
Out of curiosity, Kapitan, do you have any experience fighting the Morganas?

Fields.MenuText: They do not frighten me.
Almost none. Do you?
I've survived my share of encounters.

Fields.DialogueText: Nor me. But you did not answer my question.
Hmm... your inexperience worries me, Kapitan.
That's good to hear.
I want to make sure you're willing to do what it takes to win.

Fields.MenuText: Of course I am.
I am, within reason.
Careful. You're starting to sound a bit tyrannical.

Fields.DialogueText: Then I should have nothing to worry about.
It's all or nothing, Kapitan.
If that is what surviving requires, then so be it.
She's an interesting Belle, that's for certain.
We're approaching the base, Kapitan.
Excellent. What do we know about its current status?
It's under attack.

Fields.MenuText: Flank the enemy and attack.
Move us into position. We must defend the base.
Full speed ahead.

Fields.DialogueText: Da. A strategic approach will be best.
Agreed. We must protect our comrades.
Let's show them our full strength.
These are long odds, Kapitan. Are you confident we can obtain victory?

Fields.MenuText: Can I afford not to be?
Confidence matters not. Only victory.
Are you testing me, Kavkaz?

Fields.DialogueText: Well said.
An interesting perspective.
I want to see what you're made of, Kapitan.
This war, and my nation... neither has use for the weak, Kapitan.
Let's see how capable you really are.
@BATTLE
Vrag pochti v radiuse deystviya.
Keep us on course.
And be ready to fire on my command.
Very good, Kapitan. Good... but past battles were not perfect.

Fields.MenuText: I agree. We will do better.
Does it matter? We survived, didn't we?
You're hard to impress, aren't you?

Fields.DialogueText: Not we. You can do better. You're the Kapitan. The crew's ability has a direct correlation to your own.
Da, but I do not like to see so many casualties.
I am impressed when I see someone doing their best. I did not see that today.
*ALARM*
Almost in range...
Here come the Morganas, Kapitan.
Are you ready for this?
Are you ready, Kapitan?

Fields.MenuText: No time like the present.
Heh. I asked you first.
Just pretend they called you "sweetie" or something like that.

Fields.DialogueText: That is for certain.
Is your humor masking your fear, Kapitan?
They will certainly wish they hadn't.
@BATTLE
It's been a busy few days.
Da. The Morgana attacks keep coming.
One might almost think they'll never stop.

Fields.MenuText: Don't tell me you're tired already.
Let them come. We'll destroy them all.
How much longer do you think we can we hold up?

Fields.DialogueText: Never, Kapitan. I'll outfight anyone - man or Morgana. Watch me.
My thoughts exactly. It's good to know we're on the same page.
As long as it takes to protect our comrades and win this war. Defeat isn't an option.
I'm beginning to wonder if there's something special about this base. Why else would the Protection Force be so concerned with its protection?
Special? I wasn't told of anything.
Perhaps it's above your pay grade, sir.
*ALARM*
Another wave incoming.
Let's save the conspiracy theories for another time.
@BATTLE
We're going to need a plan, Kavkaz. I don't like the pattern we're falling into here.
We've been doing nothing but respond to immediate threats for too long.
Do you have anything in mind? I'm all ears, Kapitan.

Fields.MenuText: ... Do you have any suggestions?
We need to shore up our defenses.
We'll have to outsmart the Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: Only that whatever your plan may be, you come up with it quickly.
That's rather vague. Does your plan have any specifics?
I like the sound of it, but how will it work, practically speaking?
How many mines do we have onboard?
More than enough for whatever you have planned.
We just have to hold the Morganas off long enough to lay a mine field... as a barrier.
*ALARM*
Easier said than done.
@BATTLE
We're almost in position.
So we are.
We'd best make this quick. The Morganas show no sign of wear.

Fields.MenuText: Perhaps the Morganas are attracted to you.
I've never seen this many before.
We should call for reinforcements.

Fields.DialogueText: To me? It certainly wouldn't seem in their best interest.
We'll count them after they are destroyed.
I'm afraid we're alone on these seas for the time being, Kapitan.
I won't let the enemy gain the upper hand. I am the superior ship and I'll make sure the Morganas leave this battle well aware of that fact.
You think you're capable of making that large an impression?
I know I am, Kapitan.
*ALARM*
Well, then... let's get to it.
@BATTLE
Just a bit more... there.
We're in position.
Release the mines.

Fields.MenuText: Let's hope this works.
Now we wait for them to fall into our trap.
The Morganas won't know what hit them.

Fields.DialogueText: Forget hope. We must believe.
I cannot wait to see them destroyed.
This will teach them to take us lightly.
*ALARM*
What is that?
Enemy ships. Approaching from the south, in the opposite direction.
They won't hit the mines.
The mines will take care of the Morganas to the north.
We'll see to these newcomers ourselves.
It will be my pleasure, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
Kapitan?
I see them. Move to engage - I don't want them coming to visit us back at the base.
Da.
@BATTLE
All enemies defeated.
How are our comrades at the base?

Fields.MenuText: I wasn't entirely sure that was a priority for you.
I'm sure they're fine.
We don't have time to worry about them.

Fields.DialogueText: I always care about my comrades, Kapitan. That much should have been clear to you, by now.
I pray you are right.
We should make time. We were charged with protecting them.
If I might be permitted to visit the radio room?
By all means.
... And?
I'm hearing reports of many injured.
The base is not equipped to care for so many wounded.
Right. The wounded will need to be transported.
I volunteer. Bring them aboard.

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure? Taking the time to bring on that many wounded could be dangerous.
Yes. We should do what we can to help.
Careful. Didn't you warn me of becoming attached?

Fields.DialogueText: It is worth the risk for the lives of our comrades.
I'll inform the base that we are en route.
This is not attachment. It is our duty to do what's right.
Kavkaz, some of the crew have been bringing me... complaints.
About what?
About you.
I see. It must be about the sewing.
Yes, about that...
They are making clothing for our comrades back home.

Fields.MenuText: And do you want to explain why?
Isn't there a better use of everyone's time?
So you knew they'd complain?

Fields.DialogueText: Because we have a duty to the less fortunate. We have the ability to help them, so it's only natural that we do.
You'd rather them devote their time to something other than altruism?
Da. That's why I also explained the consequences for failing to work.
The crew says you've been threatening them.
I have not...
I merely suggested that those that didn't pitch in might want to consider how well they can swim.
Well, it would appear most of our crew members are not confident swimmers.
Trust me, Kapitan, this is for the good of our crew and those at home.
We'll see...
@BATTLE
How are the wounded holding up?
For the time being, they are stable.
But they need more medical attention than we're able to give. It's imperative that we get them to a hospital as soon as possible.

Fields.MenuText: We're going as fast as we can.
I'm surprised you're so worried about them.
Don't worry. We'll make it.

Fields.DialogueText: Time is of the essence.
I've made this clear before, Kapitan. They are our comrades. They are deserving of our care.
If that's a promise, I'll hold you to it, Kapitan.
I've charted a course that should save us time.
However, it does go straight through the enemy territory.

Fields.MenuText: It's too risky. We should navigate around those waters.
If it's the fastest route, it's worth the risk.
Is there no better route?

Fields.DialogueText: But the lives of our comrades are at stake.
Agreed. I'll set our new course.
I've looked. This is our best option, Kapitan.
*ALARM*
We have Morganas incoming.
We may have to use your route whether we like it or not.
@BATTLE
Kapitan?
What's on your mind?
These constant enemy attacks are slowing us down.

Fields.MenuText: We have to push through.
Should we retreat?
This route was a mistake.

Fields.DialogueText: Da. For our wounded comrades.
Retreat now and we doom our comrades to death.
Doing what's right is never a mistake.
The only way out of this is through, Kapitan. Right. Through. The. Enemy.
Fine. Let's push through.
If the wounded die, it will be on us, Kapitan.

Fields.MenuText: Me more than anyone.
Don't put that on my conscience.
I can't control everything that happens.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll share the blame with you. This route was my idea.
I hope it weighs heavy enough to inspire you.
Nyet, but we can control the outcome of this next battle.
*ALARM*
We will make it through, Kapitan.
I trust you, Kavkaz.
@BATTLE
We've broken through! I knew you could do it, Kapitan.
I can see the shore from here. Our comrades will be saved.
*ALARM*
Oh, no.
The Morganas... they've formed a blockade.
They're the last thing between us and getting help to our wounded comrades.

Fields.MenuText: Attack. We'll pierce right through them.
Maneuver around them. Leave as many of them in our wake as we can.
We'll stand our ground and fight.

Fields.DialogueText: Da. For our comrades.
We must hurry. Lives are at stake.
We must finish this battle quickly, Kapitan. Our wounded comrades can't wait much longer.
One more battle. They only have to hold on for one more battle.
They must. Our comrades are strong.
@BATTLE
Command has sent us a commendation on a job well done.
We saved a lot of lives, Kavkaz.
I'm merely happy to have served our comrades and my nation.

Fields.MenuText: We should celebrate.
You deserve as much credit as anyone.
Yes. A mission accomplished is its own reward.

Fields.DialogueText: A celebration? Ha... sounds like a waste of time to me.
Let's call it a team effort then, Kapitan.
I'm content knowing we accomplished our objective.
Some of the other Comrades of the Fleet would see this as an opportunity to party...
Those girls... always drinking, basking in luxury...

Fields.MenuText: What's wrong with that?
You sound like you hate the others.
Do you think it makes them weak?

Fields.DialogueText: Luxury is a soft blanket which coddles. It creates weakness.
I do not hate them. But I do not approve of their behavior.
Da. Let the enemy have luxury. Let it make them weak.
If they want to have a party, they should consider the Communist Party...
Did you just make a joke?
Well, I attempted to...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
What are you reading?
It's... hm.
"Hm"?
Are you religious, Kapitan?

Fields.MenuText: I am.
I'm not.
I prefer to keep such subjects to myself.

Fields.DialogueText: Belief is a good thing, Kapitan. This book, the Avesta, is my religious text.
In that case, it might be difficult to explain, but know that this book, the Avesta, is a text central to the practice of my religion.
Very well. This book, the Avesta, is my religious text.
It is the holy book of Zoroastrianism.
Hm. We've hardly ever talked about what you believe, Krasny. Is it something you're willing to discuss?
It's... a complicated subject.

Fields.MenuText: Some other time, then.
Please. I'm willing to listen.
Are you ashamed to explain it?

Fields.DialogueText: Da. Maybe so, Kapitan.
I suppose I could try to explain.
Certainly not.
I'll leave you with one question, for now.
What is it?
Do you believe there is absolute good and absolute evil in the world?
@BATTLE
Hm.
You seem deep in thought, Kavkaz.
Oh!
My apologies, Kapitan. You caught me daydreaming.

Fields.MenuText: Don't let it happen again.
What were you daydreaming about?
I thought you might be remembering old grudges.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, Kapitan. I will be better disciplined in the future.
Sometimes, I fantasize about... mountains...
Heh. While I entertain thoughts of grudges from time to time, now is not one of those times.
It's just that... there is something I have always imagined doing...
Never mind me. It's silly. Was there something you needed?
We have a new mission. A Protection Fleet base near our position is under heavy fire.
Another defense mission?
No. At this point, the base is lost. We've been ordered to assist with evacuations.
I will take ten enemy lives for every one of our comrades that is lost.

Fields.MenuText: Will ten be enough?
Don't lose your compassion. It's why we were chosen for this.
We'll save them all. I promise.

Fields.DialogueText: Let our comrades know we're coming.
You're right, sir. Anger has no place here.
I will make sure you keep your word, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
It won't be much longer. I hope our comrades are holding up.
We'll get there in time.
Have you been considering my question, Kapitan?
About whether there is absolute good and evil?
Da. That one.

Fields.MenuText: If there is a God in heaven there must be a Devil in hell.
Good and evil are rather subjective, don't you think?
I don't really concern myself with such things.

Fields.DialogueText: Your faith fascinates me, Kapitan.
The world is more black and white than some would like to believe.
You should always be concerned with the truth, Kapitan.
There is an absolute truth, Kapitan. It guides us all.
Guides us to what?
Ah, that is a question we all must answer for ourselves.
*ALARM*
In due time, of course.
@BATTLE
I have the base in our sights.
Are they still putting up a fight?
Barely. The enemy is overwhelming them.

Fields.MenuText: Rescuing the troops is our top priority.
Let's help them defeat the enemy.
We may be in over our heads, here.

Fields.DialogueText: We can save them by defeating the enemy.
We'll take advantage of the element of surprise.
Nothing to do about it now. We must attack.
The enemy concentration on the base will be their downfall.
They won't expect us to attack their flank.
Prepare for battle.
@BATTLE
Kapitan, if we mean to intercept the enemy before they can fire on the shore...
I know.
Push the engines hard, people! We can't afford to dawdle!
Hurry. We have to get those troops on board before the next enemy attack.
We're receiving a transmission from the base...
They have suffered heavy casualties.

Fields.MenuText: We must do what we can.
If only we had gotten here sooner.
We'll take revenge for every comrade we've lost.

Fields.DialogueText: There is still hope for those living.
We did the best we could. But we can still help the living.
I will never forgive the enemy for this.
*ALARM*
Enemy approaching from behind.
Morgana reinforcements.
We'll have to defend the base.
Are you praying for our victory?
Nyet. I'm praying that our path remains true.
@BATTLE
There are more, Kapitan.
There always are.
Ready for another round?
It's more appealing than letting them just sail by.
@BATTLE
How long until all of the evacuees are on board?
We've just loaded the last of them, Kapitan.

Fields.MenuText: I want get away from here as soon as possible.
Nothing about this mission has gone well.
We won't easily recover from this defeat.

Fields.DialogueText: The best we can do now is get our comrades to safety.
So many lives have been lost...
And I won't easily forgive the Morganas either.
How are you holding up, Kavkaz?
Honestly, Kapitan? I feel nothing...
N-nothing?
Nothing except... rage.

Fields.MenuText: Use it to fuel you in battle.
Anger will do you no good today.
I feel the same way.

Fields.DialogueText: It will. I won't soon let this go.
I beg to differ, Kapitan.
Then let's share our rage with the enemy.
I've received word. We're ready to depart.
If it were up to me, we'd launch a counterattack instead.
Damage report.
We're above water. That's all that matters.
We won't be able to outrun the enemy much longer.
Good. I see no more point in running.
Do you believe in evil now, Kapitan?

Fields.MenuText: I believe we have an enemy to defeat.
It's not that simple, Kavkaz.
How else could the enemy be described?

Fields.DialogueText: Then you have not yet seen the truth.
You will learn, Kapitan.
I can think of worse words, to be sure.
Do you think the Morganas have their own truth?
They are motivated by something. That implies they believe something.
What does that mean for us?
That we must show them the fallacy of their belief - through force.
@BATTLE
The Morganas seem hell bent on running us down.
Let them come.
We should stand our ground and fight.

Fields.MenuText: Don't let your emotions get the best of you.
Don't forget about our mission.
We're in no state keep up this fighting.

Fields.DialogueText: This has nothing to do with emotion. We know what we're capable of. The Morganas should be made aware, as well.
The best way to save our comrades would be to destroy the enemy.
We're on the path of truth, Kapitan. We will be fine.
*ALARM*
More Morgana vessels, approaching from bow and stern.
They have us surrounded.
They are the ones who should be afraid.
@BATTLE
Those Morganas aren't about to let us by without a fight. And we're so close to our destination...
We'll have to cut a hole through the Morganas' ranks. That's the only way we'll make it past.
Or we could just destroy them all.

Fields.MenuText: You have to be more level-headed about this.
You're not equipped for that sort of warfare, Kavkaz.
Have you forgotten our comrades already?

Fields.DialogueText: Believe me. My thinking is perfectly clear.
I know what I can do.
I only fight for them - and to avenge those whom we've lost.
Now is not the time for grudges. We need a real plan.
If we can break through their ranks, we can cover our escape path with mines.
It's worked in the past.
Kapitan...
You said "path"...
Yes?
Never mind...
@BATTLE
I've informed Command that we're on our way with the evacuees.
And I think we're past the blockades, so with luck we won't lose anybody else along the way.

Fields.MenuText: Is something wrong?
You should be happy. We've made it.
We did our best. Don't be hard on yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: I am disappointed in myself.
I am happy. But I am not satisfied.
My best was not good enough.
There will be many more missions, many more chances...
... For revenge.
So revenge is your guiding force?
I feel revenge is pointing me towards the path of truth.
You cannot let this war make you cruel.
There have to be other things you care about.
Do you want to know something I care about, Kapitan?

Fields.MenuText: Of course.
Only if you're willing to share.
Not if you cannot be honest with me.

Fields.DialogueText: I do not share this often...
Perhaps it will help to share...
This is an honest answer...
... I would like to climb mountains someday. To scale the highest peaks in the world.

Fields.MenuText: I'd like to do that with you, someday.
You will someday. You'll see.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe. We shall see where our paths lead us.
That is another promise I will hold you to, Kapitan.
One more pack of them, Kavkaz!
@BATTLE
